History of Present Illness:
Mr. ___ is a ___ y/o M w/ bipolar disorder on ECT,
recurrent PE/DVTs on elliquis, CKD, DMII,and OSA, presenting now
as a transfer to medicine for evaluation for AMS and acute on
chronic kidney disease after prolonged psychiatric
hospitalization. 

Patient was admitted to the hospital on ___ under voluntary
agreement for further management of his worsening symptoms of
depression. Per psychiatry, his presenting symptoms were
concerning for worsening of his underlying Bipolar Disorder Type
I. In addition, he was noted to have negativism, verbigeration,
and withdrawal, concerning for the development of catatonia. He
was continued on his home fluoxetine, olanzapine, and lithium,
but had increased frequency of ECT treatments. In addition, he
was initiated on lorazepam on ___ with increasing frequency of
doses to q4hrs given improvement in symptoms of catatonia.
However on ___, there was concern for changing mental status,
and in particular increasing somnolence/delirium. Basic delirium
workup was notable only for mild leukocytosis and acute on
chronic kidney disease. Medicine was consulted for evaluation,
and recommended transfer to medicine for further management.
___ hospital course was also notable for chest pain and
hypertension following his first ECT treatment on ___, with EKG
concerning for more pronounced TWI in V1-4, but on further
evaluation there was low concern for ACS. 

On arrival to the floor, patient reports overall feeling sick. 
He
states he has some abdominal discomfort, and his left eye feels
slightly dry. Per discussion with his wife, she states he seems
still a little altered, but also did not see him the last few
days when his mental status had begun to change. Prior to 
further
questioning, patient states "I think that is enough for now".

Brief Hospital Course:
BRIEF HOSPITAL COURSE
====================
Mr. ___ is a ___ y/o M w/ Bipolar Disorder c/b 
catatonia, TIIDM, and CKD, presented as transfer from inpatient 
psychiatry for altered mental status and acute on chronic kidney 
disease. His ___ has responded well to fluid repletion and is 
now
at baseline. Additionally, his orthostasis seems to be chronic 
in nature. He has responded to repletion very well and is now 
asymptomatic with ambulation. He is no longer somnolent or 
disoriented. He displays good attention. It's at this point that
we feel he is medically stable and a good candidate to be 
transferred back to the psychiatric unit.  
 
ACUTE/ACTIVE ISSUES
====================
#. Acute on Chronic Kidney Disease 
Mr. ___ presented with ___ of 2.2 up from baseline Cr 
1.6-1.8. This was suspected secondary to poor PO/hypovolemia in 
setting of catatonia and subsequent somnolence. Also considered 
was contribution from medications including lithium. This was 
held on transfer. He was given IVF with good response. Cr 
downtrended to baseline levels.

#Orthostatic Hypotension
Mr. ___ has history of orthostasis prevously treated with 
midodrine in ___,
was d/c'd iso urinary incontinence. Orthostatcis showed drop in 
SBP ~40. He has
This was most likely iso reduced PO over previous week iso 
catatonia and subsequent somnolence/delirium. Repleted with IVF. 
He was ambulating around the floor on day of discharge without 
lightheadedness, dizziness. 

#. Altered Mental Status
Suspected most likely etiology is over sedation with Ativan, as 
well as some contribution from delirium. Appeared to be 
improving while holding Ativan. Also considered infectious 
etiology although all work-up was negative and he denies any 
localizing infectious source. No focal neurological findings to 
suggest central process. He became less somnolent. He was alert 
and oriented with good attention. Re-started low dose Ativan iso 
return of catatonic symptoms. Continued to monitor for signs of 
delirium/AMS.

#. Bipolar Disorder Type I c/b Catatonia 
Had displayed symptoms of catatonia while in unit including 
negativism, verbigeration. While here still with some of these 
symptoms, wanting to abruptly end conversations, refusing meds 
and vitals in am, and some impulsivity. Was re-started on Ativan 
1mg q6h. ECT sch for ___. Held Lithium, Ativan iso ECT. 
continued on fluoxetine, olanzaprine qhs

#. Left Eye Conjunctivitis 
Patient had erythema and dry, pustular discharge of left eye, 
concerning for conjunctivitis. Patient not significantly 
symptomatic, suspected likely viral vs bacterial conjunctivitis. 
Was started on erythromycin drops. 

CHRONIC/STABLE ISSUES:
======================
#. Recurrent PEs 
- Continued home apixaban 

#. DMII 
- Hold home metformin
- Continue ISS
